III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 provided Youth A with a vape pen before they returned
home.
Investigation This complaint was received on 01/08/2024 and investigated
jointly with the MDHHS Specialist.
Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant on 01/05/2024 via telephone, she
reported Youth A and Youth B were drug screened after an
overnight home pass on 12/26/2023. Youth A and Youth B’s drug
screen were positive for marijuana. She spoke with both Youths,
and they denied using any drugs while on their home pass. She
said both Youths home passes have been revoked. When Youth
A was informed that his home pass was revoked, he told her that
a female staff gave him a vape pen the day before he went on a
home pass.
I interviewed Manager on 01/08/2024 at the facility, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Manager reported Youth A
and Youth B both tested positive for marijuana after going on an
overnight home pass on 12/25/2023. Youth A went on a day pass
on 12/23/2023 and was drug tested upon his return. Results were
confirmed the same day and Youth A tested negative. Youth A
initially denied using any drugs, but after a telephone call with his
mother informing her his home pass will be revoked, Youth A told
the Director a male staff gave him a vape pen the morning of
12/24/2023. She said Staff 1 and Staff 2 were working on Pod J
on 12/24/2023.
I interviewed Youth A on 01/08/2024 at the facility in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the facility for 8
months and he is on Pod J. He admitted he tested positive for
marijuana after going on an overnight home pass for Christmas.
He said he used a vape pen that a male staff gave him on the
morning of 12/24/2023. He refused to provide the male staff’s
name. He said no one witnessed the staff giving him the vape
2

pen. Youth A said he was on the Pod in the main common area
when the staff gave him the pen.
I attempted to interview Youth B on 01/08/2024, but Youth B
refused to be interviewed.
I interviewed Youth C on 01/08/2024 at the facility, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the
facility for 6 months and is placed on Pod J. Youth C denied
witnessing staff members using a vape pen or giving any of the
residents a vape pen. Youth C reported all his needs are being
met, feeling safe, and expressed no concerns regarding staff
members.
I spoke with Youth A’s CMO Worker on 01/09/2024. She met with
Youth A on 01/08/2024. Youth A told her a male staff gave him a
vape pen, but he refused to provide the staff’s name. She said
Youth A was being very evasive and didn’t make eye contact
during her visit, so she can’t be sure he was being truthful.
I spoke with Manager on 01/10/2024 at the facility, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Manager reported Staff 1
and Staff 2 worked on Pod J on 12/24/2023. She said initially
Youth A reported it was a female staff that gave him the vape pen.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 01/10/2024 at the facility, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 has been working at the facility for
6 months, has completed all new hire training, and has no
discipline actions. Staff 1 recalled working on 12/23/2023 on Pod J
and is familiar with Youth A. She denied providing Youth A or any
other resident with a vape pen. She does not bring any personal
items to the Pod. She said on 12/24/2023, Youth A and Youth B
were talking about partying and hanging out with each other when
they go on the overnight home pass. Staff 1 said she doesn't bring
anything on the Pod because after going through security, staff
have to lock up personal items before going on the pods.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 01/10/2024 at the facility, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 has been working at the facility for
4 months. Staff 2 is aware that Youth A and Youth B had tested
positive for marijuana after a home pass. She denied witnessing
or hearing that staff provided the Youth’s with a vape pen. She
said staff are searched before entering the facility and staff are not
allowed to have any personal items (phones, watches, etc.) on the
pods.
3

I interviewed Youth D on 01/10/2024 at the facility, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth D is currently on Pod
C, but was previously on Pod J. He was moved to Pod C on
01/09/2024. Youth D has been at the facility for 15 months. Youth
D denied witnessing staff or other residents use or have a vape
pen. He has never witnessed staff giving Youths anything besides
advice. Youth D denied having any issues or concerns regarding
staff.
A predisposition conference held with MDHHS Specialist on
02/02/2024. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist.
Video reviewed:
I reviewed video footage for Pod J for the morning of 12/24/2023.
Staff 1 is observed on the Pod walking around the Pod, Youth A
walked out of his room and spoke to Staff 1. Youth C walked
around the common area. Youth A walked towards Youth B’s
room and appears to be talking to Youth B, who was still in his
room. Youth A again walked up to Staff 1, and they appear to be
talking. Staff 1 is sitting at the table in the common area. Youth A
walked back to Youth B’s room, Staff 1 followed him, and two
seconds later Youth A and Youth B walked out of the room. Staff 1
went back to the table and appeared to be passing out clothing to
the Youths on the pod.
Documents reviewed:
• DMC University Laboratories report for Youth A, dated
12/26/2023, Youth A tested positive for cannabinoids on
12/26/2023.
• Incident report dated 12/28/2024, report for Youth A’s drug
screen completed on 12/26/2024; positive cannabinoids.
• Staff 1 does not have disciplinary action in her personnel file.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted there is insufficient evidence that
staff provided youth with a vape pen. Youth A initially reported a
female staff gave him the vape pen, but when interviewed he
reported it was a male staff. Youth A refused to provide the male
staff’s name.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
